result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant James Dean Ottman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James Dean Ottman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James Dean Ottman was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Count 2 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 1.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  James Dean Ottman appeared. Case called at 8:32 a.m. ADA Nieskes moves to dismiss Ct. 1, Ct.3 plead and Ct.2 enter into a deferred  agreement. State has complied with victims rights. Atty O'Boyle is in agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 and Ct 3 WITHOUT the domestic abuse enhancer in 15CF167 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 3 without the domestic abuse enhancer in 15CF167. Court will reserve adjudication on Ct.3. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF167. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Bond will remain in affect until completion of the  diversion program.  Crt orders on Ct. 3:

- Misdemeanor Court Costs $243.00 and DNA Surcharge of $200.00. Add to current payment plan

- DNA Sample

- Meet with the diversion coordinator today
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 08:30 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John M. O'Boyle, DF: James Dean Ottman appeared.  Court called at 10:36 a.m.  Set for PTC.  ADA Nieskes advises the court there is an agreement.  State will prepare the DJOC.  Set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Court adjourned at 10:36 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

filed by ADA Frank Collins. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2015 at 08:45 am.

CO: RMW; REP: Drost; CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  James Dean Ottman appeared. Case called at 10:27 a.m. State calls Officer Edwards to the stand. S/T Officer Edwards, Officer with the Somerset Police Department. ADA Collins directs. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. No redirect by the state. Witness excused at 10:38 a.m. State rests. Argument by Atty O'Boyle. ADA Collins makes argument. Requests court to find probable cause and bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds defendant over for trial. ADA Collins files an information with the court. Atty O'Boyle would like to continue with the arraignment. Court informs Def if charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty O'Boyle waives any futher reading and waives speedy trial. Enters NG pleas on all counts. 10 days to file substitution. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Left v/m with DE asking which address he wld like his mail sent to - address confirmed on his bond or the address listed on his Pet for Appt of Atty.  DE ret'd call & stated to have his mail be addressed to the address on his bond. jaf

to Withdraw Motion to Modify Bond. Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Carol W.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: CAR, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  James Dean Ottman appeared from jail. Court confirms address.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Request prelim. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
